snippet: Staff members had tried to prepare for the impact of a tabloid newspaper article about John Edwards’s extramarital affair, one former aide testified.
abstract: Former campaign aides Elizabeth Christina Reynolds and Josh Brumberger take the stand in the federal trial of John Edwards; describe the devastated reaction of Elizabeth Edwards, following a National Inquirer article describing her husband's extramarital affair. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: GREENSBORO, N.C. -- As John Edwards sat motionless, his eyes cast downward at his federal trial here on Wednesday, a former campaign aide described the devastating effect a tabloid newspaper article about his extramarital affair had had on Mr. Edwards's wife, Elizabeth. The aide, Elizabeth Christina Reynolds, 37, who was research director and a senior communications adviser during Mr. Edwards's 2008 presidential campaign, testified that Mr. Edwards had assured his wife in the summer of 2007 that his affair, with a former campaign videographer, Rielle Hunter, was over.

headline.main: Former Edwards Aides Tell of Affair's Impact on Wife and Campaign
